Robert C.  Martin wrote an article in IEEE Software magazine las=
t year
called "The Test Bus Imperative: Architectures That Support Automate=
d
Acceptance Testing". This article contains a lot of good insights on how
=
to approach the problem of automated testing of GUIs. You can find the
arti=
cle at http://doi.ieeecomputersociety.org/10.1109/MS.2005.110 - though
you =
need to have membership to the IEEE Computer Society to view the
thing, or =
pay $20

To summarise the main point of the article, strive to ensure that =
*all*
logic in your software has a testable interface (aka test bus). The G=
UI
becomes a very thin shell over testable presentation logic, which hooks
=
into lower level business logic, and so on (all of which is testable).
